In 2002, Rogan started his mixed martial arts (MMA) career as a commentator for the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), a position he still holds today. His enthusiasm and expertise have made him a fan favorite, and he's known for his color commentary and witty banter.

In 2009, Rogan launched his eponymous podcast, "The Joe Rogan Experience," which has become one of the most popular and influential podcasts in the world. The podcast features long-form conversations with a wide range of guests from various fields, including celebrities, musicians, comedians, scientists, and thought leaders. The podcast has been downloaded over 20 million times and has gained a reputation for its eclectic mix of topics and in-depth discussions.

Rogan has also acted in several films and television shows, including "NewsRadio," "The Simpsons," "Entourage," and "Here Comes the Boom." He's also appeared on various comedy specials, including his own stand-up special "Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space" (2009).

Throughout his career, Rogan has been recognized for his work, including multiple awards and nominations for his podcast and comedy specials. He's also been praised for his advocacy on various issues, including mental health awareness and environmental conservation.

Today, Joe Rogan is widely regarded as one of the most influential and entertaining figures in the entertainment industry, with a massive following across social media platforms and a reputation for being a candid, insightful, and engaging conversationalist.
